greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Permutation of natural numbers: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = 2*a(n), a(2n+1) = A003961(1+a(n)). [Where A003961(n) shifts the prime factorization of n one step towards larger primes].
comment: This can be viewed as yet another "entanglement permutation" where the two complementary pairs to be interwoven together are even and odd numbers (A005843/A005408) which are entangled with the complementary pair even numbers (taken straight) and odd numbers in the order they appear in A003961: (A005843/A003961). Sequence A163511 has almost the same definition, but its domain starts from 0, which results a different permutation.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
Index entries for sequences that are permutations of the natural numbers
formula: a(1) = 1, a(2n) = 2*a(n), a(2n+1) = A003961(1+a(n)). [Where A003961(n) shifts the prime factorization of n one step towards larger primes].
As a composition of related permutations:
Other identities. For all n >= 1 the following holds:
A000035(a(n)) = A000035(n). [Like A005940 & A005941, this also preserves the parity].
program: A003961(n) = my(f = factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 1] = nextprime(f[i, 1]+1)); factorback(f); \\ Using code of _Michel Marcus_
xref: Similar or related permutations: A005940, A005941, A163511, A245606, A246378, A246379.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 27 2014
